pages.text: This zatracheidid temnospondyl amphibian lived during the Early Permian, in what is now the DÃ¶hlen Basin of Germany. Over 30 specimens have been discovered, giving palaeontologists a good record of how the animal changed as it aged. Of note is that adults had a complex bony apparatus that may have supported the tongue.
